set something/somebody ↔ down.translatio: to write about something so that you have a record of it
I wanted to set my feelings down on paper.
to state how something should be done in an official document or set of rules
Clear guidelines have been set down for teachers.
to stop a car, bus etc and allow someone to get out
The driver set her down at the station.
to establish rules, laws etc about how something should be done
Banking regulators could set down similar rules for sales practices by banks.
